review: This has always been my favorite Red Robin! Great food and great service! We decided to go on a Friday night and it was packed. My first thought was that our food was going to take a while, but I was wrong. Our food came out at a reasonable time and our waitress was a nice young lady who was always making sure our drinks were full and we were doing ok. I love it when a waiter/waitress knows how to do their job well, that really reflects on the dedication of the restaurant.  I love the burgers here. They always taste amazing and live up to being "gourmet" burgers. Slightly pricy but for what you get (including bottomless fries) I believe it's worth it.  Go here.. It'll be worth it.

This is truly my favorite restaurant ever. I always ask for Jolene, she's the best! Makes the whole experience even better. The fries sprinkled with their seasoning and with a side of fry sauce is definitely my favorite and the main reason why I go there. I usually get the crispy chicken tender salad which is delicious but I always make sure someone in my party gets a burger in order to get bottomless fries or they'll charge you every time you get fries.

Good lunch.  I had the Thanksgiving turkey burger and it was delicious, the cranberry sauce made the burger.  Points off for not leaving the mayo off...they had to redo my burger  Our server Tyler (a woman) was awesome.  Service from her was great.   My husband also enjoyed his lunch.    The cronuts was soooooo good!!!! It's an appetizer and everyone needs to eat these! I could've eaten a whole plate of these.
Excellent food and good price and excellent service. I've at at red Robin a lot over the years.
The BBQ Tavern Cheeseburger with onion straws was off the hook!  Honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had.

I went in to get a to go order, by the time I left is was lost 1 hour later.  I was ignored the first 20 minutes I was there until I spoke up and asked for help.  I must have seen a dozen employees who did not acknowledge me.  The fries were cold.  the Monster Milk Shake was in a medium size drink cup that was half full with part of that being whip cream.  I took video of the employees standing around watching the baseball game or talking to each other.  Horrible customer service.

Red Robin is our go to restaurant! There is something for everyone and it really does seem gourmet! The Layton location recently had a remodel which we love! It is clean, the staff is friendly and the manager has always come to our table and asked if we have any concerns. They've been very good at fixing any mistakes and making things right! We love all of the menu options, the burgers are phenomenal!

Server was kind of flakey but not horrible.   The food was fine.  Ordered burgers and fries (what a shock for RR :P)  and they were all cooked alright and tasted fine.  The endless fries is my favorite part of RR.  I'd give 4 stars if it wasn't for the flakey service and the fact that I think the food is a bit over priced.
Food is good , place is always filthy.  Tables always sticky and you can never get a clean high chair

Excellent job! After what happened, they contacted me and were really sorry about it. Sent me some gift cards and coupons home. Not only that, when I went back, the manager showed up and took care of my buger plus apologized to me again. What a gentlenman! Definitely they care about their costumers and I recommend that you if you ever have a problem with them, just let them know and they will take of it as good as they did to us.

We wanted a good, quick dinner before a 7 p. Movie time andvarrived st 6:15 for immediate seating. We had great hamburgers served up quickly with friendly and curteous service from a charming waitress (server).

The staff is very friendly and attentive, but the wait is usually not worth it. The food is good, but not amazing. I would eat here again, but it is not somewhere I would actively seek out to dine at.

I usually love Red Robin. Had the Royal Burger and this time it wasn't very flavorful. Also had the assortment of free sauces. So good!   The fries were smaller and crisper, which is good,  but I like mine bigger and softer. Service was great.

I have Celiac Disease (allergic to gluten) this place is awesome! They have a lot of great gluten free options and burgers. It's hard to find truly gluten free options and Red Robin has them. Try their burgers on a GF bun, best around!

Red Robin.... Yuuuuummmmm! We got seated quickly, server was a little busy but she made up with for it in personality. Mushroom burger and onions rings were very yummy!!  Their new BBQ salad was not a hit. First, put the darn thing in bowl, it's hard to eat it. If it's a bbq salad, don't be shy with it, put more bbq sauce instead of a little drizzle. It's was to much work to eat it. Put it in a bowl, toss it in the dressing and maybe add a little more lettuce. Other then that we were in and out, and we'll feed!

Sat in the sports bar area for a change. Jen was who waited on me and she is absolutely awesome! I got a Blue Moon and Southern Charm Burger. She brought me a water without asking which is huge bonus points. Many places just bring you the beer and count on you buying more and more unless you ask for the water. She told me in advance that the sweet potato fries take a while and if I wanted more it would be good to get the refill in advance. I had left overs and she even advised how they taste better reheated in the oven. She was super chill to talk to and was extremely nice. I'm asking for her every time I come in now and you should too!
Slowest takeout service. Waited over 15 min for someone get my order.. During the 15 min watched the manager and probably 5 waiter/waitress walk by and not even asked if I had been helped.

Home of the soggy fries. They have a good fry sauce, almost a hint of bbq and good seasoning salt. Ask for the fries well done if you don't like steamed potatoes called french frys. The sweet potato fries are shoestring so no problem there.  The bacon on the burger taste the same as McDonald's,  if you like that great, I took a bite and spit it back out on my plate. Didn't look to cool but I just was not ready for fast food taste at a sit down burger joint.  Root beer floats for the kids are bottomless and tasty. Ice tea was OK and refills came in a timely manner. Ranch dip was great. The saving grace for messing the bacon up and going with paper thin fast food leftovers was, they have a tier 2 menu, $15 burgers but hey they found some pepper bacon that resembled real food. I will go to the next level next time and order an elite burger, that really looked good. 3 stars is accurate for Red Robin, fun decor, noisy, bottomless drinks and fries, nice staff, soggy fries and paper thin bacon for third world countries bad restaurants.  Can't mess up the bacon in this country.

Red Robin has stepped up their game.  Doh Rings?  Call them what they are, Cronuts!!!  Love them, I don't care what you call them.  Good thing I got the eight pack, barely got to eat those since they get eaten quickly.  Did like the Big Sky burger.  My only concern is that the Sriracha sauce needs to be spread a little more evenly on the burger, it is a bit of a surprise when you bite into the one spot that most of the sauce is.  Garlic Herbed Fries, need to step up the level of garlic on the fries.  Good, but it could be better.  Drop by Wingers and try theirs that will give you an idea how it should taste.

Terrible service at this Red Robin. They are excited about their remodel and so were we. After being sat in the bar area, we waited more than five minutes and no service from anyone. The waitress had three tables to cover. A new person was seated right next to us and she came over to get his order without even acknowledging we were there. After that nonsense, we walked out to tell the hostess and before I could get a word out she walked away. So, we decided to leave. On the way out the manager was telling people to have a good night, so I looked him in the eyes and told him we had horrible service. What did he do? Absolutely nothing and walked away. Never eating here again. May even cut Red Robin off the list permanently. Be warned!

How can one not love Red Robin? An all-time favorite and for multiple reasons. 1) Bottomless steak fries. Enough said. These fries are some of the best in the country. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Paired with ranch and "campfire sauce" (fry sauce with some seasonings) they are fantastic! We usually ask for them to bring some out while waiting for our food. Never disappoints.  2) Delicious burgers! That's their main focus, so if you don't want burgers, don't come here. Every burger I've had has been good and fresh! I'll admit, I wish they had some more special creations, or maybe a make-your-own burger but I'm satisfied with what they have to offer.  3) Service is super friendly! They are kind and helpful when answering questions.  If you are arriving between 7-9 you're probably going to have to wait to get in, but if you get there before 6:30 you should quickly get in.  Overall, one of my favorite restaurants! Give them a try!

Red Robin just isn't in my rotation of chain restaurants.  We go 3-4 times a year but it just doesn't make the "favorites" list and I think I finally figured out why. The burgers are good. Not great, but a solid good.  They shake up the toppings, the buns, the flavors, but at the end of the day it is just a burger.  Nothing really special about it but somewhere between "meh" and The Big Kahuna Burger on Pulp Fiction. The fries are good. Steak fries always win in my book.  RR sells them as bottomless so they are pretty mass cooked and never hit the table hot and awesome.  It's not like I just solved a calculus problem here but I think that is why they aren't the awesomest of awesome.  Luke warm fries. The chicken sandwiches seem to be less than good.  Not bad, but forgettable.  They remind me of an after thought like "hey, we put 2,000 burger combinations on the menu but now realize not everyone eats red meat."  A little focus, attention, and love of poultry could make a good chicken sandwich. Would love to see this place make burgers a "WOW" experience.

Red Robin has sandwiches, burgers and bottomless fries.  I've tried their soups as well.  Overall, this location does good business, but my husband doesn't really care for their food.  I can usually find something that I like, but he struggles to find a good burger.  As a result, we don't eat here very often.  When I come, I try to select a variety off the menu so I don't get stuck in a rut. The location is within a "restaurant row" on the east side of I-15 in Layton so access is convenient off the freeway.

Average. Not as good as I remember in the past. I had the Bleu Ribbon Burger and my wife had the Prime Chophouse. Both were good, but not great. Love the bottomless fries, especially with their signature Campfire sauce. Too bad the burger fills you up so much already! We tried the fried pickle nickels appetizer, and for $5 I feel like it's a pretty good deal. There's not a bunch of them, but they are delicious (especially dipped in Campfire sauce.... Hmmm maybe I need to get some of that to bring home!) All in all a decent experience. Good service, food that is great sometimes and meh other times... We will definitely be back someday, it just may not be soon.

Service here was superb and I wish I had gotten our waitress's name :( Food was okay. I must say that today's visit was specifically so we could redeem our birthday burger (my niece gets one every year) and didn't find out til the end that they do not honor the Birthday burger rewards. Had I known, we might not have come here at all. Although our waitress was great, I felt that the salad included frozen chicken breast that was reheated, which sucked because I was really hoping for fresh chicken. It killed the salad for me. The donuts were good, but I'm just really bothered abt them not redeeming the birthday rewards. Ugh.

Was seated for 13 min and had to go up and ask the hostess if someone could wait on us. It was during a 1 hour lunch so we were time crunched. Eventually a server came over that said I will take care of you. Our server was Chad and he was amazing throughout the entire lunch! One of the burgers that was ordered had pulled pork on top and came out without pulled pork. Hence the name of the burger boss hog. As many things that went wrong in this visit Chad still made us want to come back and give them another try

Left the "bar" after sitting there for over 20 minutes with zero acknowledgement from a staff member. Not sure how much longer it would have taken for someone to actually help us or take our order since we were so frustrated that we left. Fail Red Robin

I ordered the Grilled 4-cheese Sandwich (I'd never ordered Grilled cheese at a restaurant before), and it was surprisingly good. In fact, it was yummy! The SERVICE, however, was bad, as usual. At about 1:30 pm, it wasn't crowded, but we say in the bar (away from the loudest music), with one other table of two. Our server stood over by the bar, chatting with about 5 girls (also servers).  By the time he greeted us we had decided on our beverages, debated appetizers for several minutes, and I had decided what I wanted three separate times.  Our food didn't take too long, but he hadn't brought everything, and our fries were cold and kind of floppy. He popped by long enough to ask for fry sauce, then went back to flirting, and left the dining room.  He didn't show his face again until it was obvious we were really finished. And even then he didn't offer refills, but promised to be right back with our ticket.  No drink refills, no bottomless fries, and no tip. Now no tip is significant, as my husband and I are *good* tippers. Having been a server in my younger days, I'm adamant about that.

We came on a Thursday night during the dinner rush.  Only had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated, and another 10 minutes to have our food served.   Nicole was our server.  She was prompt and attentive-really does well at her job.  Most of our group got the gourmet burgers, which they loved, along with the bottomless fries.  I continued my love affair with the Baja Turkey Club.  It's not on the menu, but they still make it...minus the big green chili pepper.  That 1 pepper is worth a 5th star. PUT IT BACK ON YOYR MENU, RR!  :) I like the new remodel, especially the sign in front that explains how RR got its start in 1969.  Had no idea this chain was that old.  This Layton location never disappoints, evidenced by its packed parking lot every day.
Lobby packed but bar area is empty. They never have a server to cover that area. Tried to there numerous times to watch games. Poor management.

Stopped here on our drive home for dinner as a family. We were seated immediately. Our server was to our table quickly and brought out our drinks in record time.  We ordered two appetizers- spinach artichoke dip and chili cheese fries. Spinach artichoke dip was good but not the best I have had. The fries were delicious.  I had the Sombrero salad with grilled chicken. It was very yummy. The salad was bright and fresh. Our server did an excellent job our whole visit. Great dining experience.

Had a pleasant experience at Red Robin. Alex was our server and he was amazing. Very attentive and had a great attitude. Little slow on getting more fries, but it was pretty busy so we understand. Will definitely be coming back!

Not about the food. Management is incompetent.  Last time I tried to eat here, I left after 10 min waiting for service,  with every employee making eye contact.  This time the place is no where near capacity, but the hostess warned it may be a while before anyone would serve us in the bar? Manager needs to go back to management 101.

One of our favorite burger chains. Place was clean and service super fast. Food came out fast and hot and as ordered. We even got our free fries to start us off. We've been to a few other Red Robin locations and this one definitely rates as one of the best.

Normally I do not write reviews. However it's been about two weeks and I am still HAUNTED! by awful experience at this restaurant.  From the time the host walked us to our seats to the time I hobbled back out to my car in my walker. (almost 2 hours later) I was completely horrified.  The restaurant was filthy, disgusting, dirty.  It felt like walking the green mile back to our booth, that was covered!! forign white gooey stains. Fry's caked into the carpet all the way back into the kitchen like Hanzel and Gretel had come through smashing food into the carpet and seats as to not get lost  on their way back to the kitchen.  We ordered drinks that were broght out to us in the bottle proudly displaying that they had expired 3 months previous. And then we waited... And waited.. I saw my dates facial hair begin to grow...my skin started to wrinkle and age, as we  waited an HOUR AND A HALF! before we finally received our cold soggy food. And during that long wait at some point in time youll need to use the restroom.  And perhaps it's because they serve expired beverages and possibly food  that has been sitting out for god knows how long... But two out of the three bathroom that were there were so horrifically clogged I thought I had walked into a crime scene. I thought I should go call for help. Maybe they didn't know disgusting it was?  Giving them the benefit out the doubt. (it was busy) when I noticed that the other person in the bathroom with me was the host! And other employees! I dont think I've ever ate at such a disgusting place. And I don't think I've ever met employees with such a careless disregard for their jobs. It was a place filled with sadness, filth  and disgusting food.

When we pulled into the parking lot on a Friday night I worried we'd have a long wait with all the cars I saw. How wrong I was! We were seated immediately and waited on right away. We both had burgers (naturally) and had onion rings which were fantastic with their chipotle dipping sauce. I had the Bleu Ribbon burger and it was tender, juicy, complex, and savory. My wife enjoyed her avocado one as well. Only knock: I was disappointed that the fries weren't salted or seasoned at all. Someone must have forgotten. Too bad because the bottomless fries are one of Red Robin's big pulls!

Our latest visit will be our last visit! Garbage just plain garbage. I ordered the Whiskey River Burger...no BBQ sauce just drowned in Mayo. Must have had 1/4 cup of that crap on it and NO onion straws either. My husbands burger NEVER has mayo on it & his was also drowning in the white crap.  Time to fire the teenagers in the kitchen & bring back the adults who know & understand their menu.

We enjoy our visit everytime. Great, consistent food quality and flavor.  I was surprised by the basket of appetizer fries. We've been there a lot and that was the first time I've seen this. I knew they did bottomless fries, but I though that was with your meal. They let me build my own burger since I'm on  a strict diet, but I am still able to enjoy their food no matter what.

I really like Red Robins.  Great food, our service was very fast as we chose to sit at the bar instead of waiting 30 mins for dining room.  The young girl hostess at the front check in was EXTREMELY SNOTTY!!!   Glad we got there when we did because a group of at least 50 teenagers showed up as we were leaving!  I posted pictures of my fish tacos and hubby's whiskey BBQ burger. I wish the fish in the fish tacos was grilled fish and not breaded and fried... But I took the breading off. They do have a gluten free  burger bun ( look on last menu page ) .    Waitress was very nice and food came fast. I'll be back.

Burgers here are great. Whiskey river BBQ burger is one of my all time favorite. Steak fries are endless and really good. It seems like the place is always busy which is definitely a good sign. Appetizers are all good as well.
I love that the BLTA Croissant comes with melon wedges.

Red Robin Yum!  This is my go to place for burgers and fries.  They have a great selection of different kinds of burgers, they are always hot and juicy. I have tried about all of them and the Red Robin is still my favorite.  I go for lunch and usually sit in the bar.  The service can be a bit slow at times, but most of the time I get great service.  I hear they have good salads and wraps too.

Just like any other dang Red Robin.... Yummmmmmmmm  This time I tried something new, the whiskey river burger, not the best on the menu, still the Burnin' Love is my go to.. still want to try a salad from here, but it would be like eating chicken at a steakhouse

Our waiter was completely awesome. He refilled drinks super quick, brought us extra fries before we asked, and gave us a lot of attention. It was somewhat busy so I was super excited we got such a great waiter who was so awesome at his job and actually seemed to be happy working there. I would definitely recommend this location and the food at Red Robin is always delicious!

Fries are good, but the meat is disgustingly cheap.  Worst burger I've ever had at a sit down restaurant.  I couldn't take more than two bites.  I'm pretty sure their meat is made from pink slime.  Disappointingly low grade.

I have yet to have a bad experience here. The burgers are spectacular and you can't go wrong with bottomless french fries. I have also had the wraps which are just as good as the burgers. Service is ok, could be faster and more attentive.

We went again last night because we had $30 in gift cards to spend.  We were leery, but went anyways.  We were pleasantly surprised by the good service.  The food quality was much better than before, but only average still.  Their menu is definitely not as good as it used to be, with the selection of non-burger entrees getting pretty small.  Still an improvement over the last time there (which I promised would be my last time.)
Wow amazing burgers, great shakes and amazing service loved this place.! The walls were slightly dirty but there were a great deal of children in herem

Is Red Robin the new McDonalds?  I've gone there twice in the past month and both times the kids outnumbered the adults.  What a terrible atmosphere.  Noisy and chaotic. As far as the food goes, I've had better burgers at McDonalds.  Don't think I'll be back.
Bottomless steak fries!!!!  Try the Royal Burger...cheese, bacon and egg on a cheeseburger!!!  What more could you ask for???
Just like every other Red Robin. Super good. No problems whatsoever.

Been coming here off and on for years. It used to be better back when they first opened. Better service. More smiles. Etc. The food choices here have always been great. Tastes good all around. I enjoy the Pasta Alfredo with grilled chicken. It USED to come with shrimp but not anymore. That sucks. Needs a bigger waiting area though. Gets crowded.

Great place to go for a burger or a wrap.  They've changed a few things since I last went, and we were mildly disappointed with the Whiskey River BBQ wrap .  Still a good place and we will hope to return soon. The wrap had no bbq flavor like they used to.  I'm not sure if an ingredient was missed or if that is a change to their recipe.

Good bottomless fries and sauce is a big reason we come here with the kids. The food I would say is good but not gourmet...but I don't expect that when we come. It's traditional. The drinks are getting more and more expensive where you save 10 dollars by drinking water versus coke. They try with the kids meals to give more choices which I like. They have more options than most when it comes to the kids. Service this time around was ok, after waiting 20 minutes we had to ask for the fries that are normally brought out to your table after ordering. She acted surprised we asked. The food was brought promptly and was cooked to order, so no complaints there.

I love that Red Robin has bottomless fries and bottomless freckled (strawberry) lemonade.  I love their fry sauce and love that they give plenty of ranch dressing for those of us who like to dip our fries in ranch.  I had the fish and chips and holy moly they were amazing.  I loved the cod they used it was amazing.  Our server was Billy Jo or Billy Jean , I don't know because she's not my lover, she's just a girl that served us our food, but the fish was really good. (Please note for the younger yelpers I was making a sad attempt at Michael Jackson's Billie Jean)  She was a great waitress.  Very attentive and never let our drinks go dry.

Average is the word that comes to mind....  Average burgers, average onion rings & fries, average bar, average service...  Most of the things that they cook come in frozen and are just deep fried, warmed up, or served as they come in....  I prefer fresher and more original burger creations as well as service....  I'm not sure why the service is slow, they always seem to have an abundance of servers when I have visited...  But they just aren't that attentive.  I guess I will take it for what it is....  A national chain....

Red Robin is a gourmet burger place by commercials they run.  The burgers are good for the most part, but not the best I have had.  It is a great place to go for a nice sit down burger compared to other places.  I have eaten at this Red Robin twice so far and each time was good. This time I went with family for a birthday (give 2 cupcakes to the b-day person).  I ordered a burger with onion strings, mushrooms, and cheese with bottomless fries.  The fries are just OK and the burger was good other than the sauce.  Fry sauce is a unique and pretty good.  We also ordered the onion rings which were OK, but I prefer more union in each ring.  My son had chicken tenders with fries which was pretty good. Service was very good and asked fairly often how things were.  Glasses and other items were tended to in a decent time period.  I would say that Red Robin is worth going to every so often, but there are better burger joints around.

Love the bottomless fries here. Great food, Had a reds Double Tavern Burger for cheap. was out for a MC ride and stopped for a lunch here. good service and good food. Only reason for loosing one star is the fries seemed a bit overcooked to me, but they were still good

Great burgers.  Bottomless fries.  What more could you want?  The dining room is busy and noisy, but with a fun atmosphere. We asked the waitress if they would sing happy birthday to our son.  She said that too many people complained and so they had to stop.  I thought that was kind of strange considering you have to shout to talk to someone across the table. ---------------- I am updating my review.  I went there again.  They have upgraded their menu (meaning they have raised prices).  There is no more $5 cheese burger.  Too bad, that was my favorite.  I'm still a fan, but I don't think I'll go there as often now that it costs about $10 for a burger and a drink.

A dine in burger joint that is freakishly consistent, Red Robin never fails to deliver an above average burger and experience. Great fries are made better by free refills and a plethora of sauces. Great patties all around, from beef to chicken to a surprisingly loyal following behind the veggie Patty. Switch up your burgers to try something adventuresome. You won't be sorry you did.

My overall experience here was sub-par. The only reason this is getting 2-stars is because the burger was good. First, I was here on a Sunday afternoon so maybe that was why service was pathetic.  Upon walking in I noticed the place was pretty empty so I figured quick service....wrong, there was a waiting list...whatever...5 minutes later I am asked if I don't mind sitting in the bar area which I said sure...only thing was the bar area was completely void of anyone and it took that long for them to ask...  5 min. after being seated I get the waitress asking for my drink which all I wanted was water...good thing I didn't ask for anything else because the water took ten minutes just to arrive...mind you the place is pretty much empty and you have at least five of the workers gathered in the sports area chatting away like its high school.  I finally got my food "only good part of the trip" and at least it came out alright. Of course after I got my food, I never saw my waitress again except for my bill...  I always give a place two chances to get things right so I will try going on a weekday...otherwise based on this visit alone, it was a pretty horrible experience.

Worst service ever, the bar tender could not answer simple questions about his drafts and the manager could not figure out who was our sever.  We left after 15 minutes and all the servers ignored us as well as the manager who put his headphones in and rolled his napkins.

If you are unfamiliar with the Red Robin franchise, then it is a gourmet burger joint.  They have quite a few selections of burgers among other items such as pasta and salads.  They also serve "bottomless" fries with your burgers.  Their burgers are pretty large, and their fries just don't stop.  They are a little on the pricey side for a burger joint.  They do have excellent dipping sauce for the fries, and they have their own "Season All" to sprinkle which is excellent. There were 5 of us that went there the last time and the bill came to be about 50.00.  Figure 10 apiece wouldn't be that bad, but we had 2 of the burgers comped.   We had a birthday coupon that gave us a free burger (which was shared by 2 people) and they didn't quite cook my burger enough, it was real pink in the middle, so they comped that one as well.    This is the 2nd time they have brought me a burger that isn't cooked all the way.    The waitress only visited our table a few times, and it took her a long time in between.   So with the price, and being served a "raw" burger 2 different times, I am only rating them a 2.

Their black beans (a side) are delicious, though sparse. Their wrap comes with a delicious sauce. My companion had a lettuce wrapped burger that she loved so much she went back a second time in a week for the no-bun burger (and fries). Much better than most "chain" restaurants.

The server did not introduce himself, let my $2.49(!) soda sit empty for 4-5 minutes at a time, and despite ordering fish and 'unending' chips, never offered more steak fries, although the plate was empty.  When I flagged him down to refill my drink and order more steak fries, he returned with the check instead and not a single refill of the fries ever showed up.  The food itself was of fair quality, but the experience was badly overshadowed by the inattention of the server.

Was very pleased with my first visit to a red robin. The staff was quick on everything!( to seat, to order) all the staff helped one another. Since it was our first time there the manager came out to greeted us with free appetizers. Our food was delicious and reasonably priced. We went on a Friday night and it was a bit busy, but like I said we were well taken care of. I also liked the family dining atmosphere.

We moved to the area a little over 9 months ago, and were excited to see a Red Robin as it's one of our favorite restaurants. However, this location has really ruined it for us. Its just consistently bad service, with unfriendly hostesses and forgetful, slow waiters. Foods great but not worth the hassle of crappy service.

Food at RR is always great. Atmosphere is very laid back, their burgers are priced well and taste good. Bottomless streak fries with every hamburger is a huge plus. Of course, you shouldn't come if you're dieting or trying to lose weight.  My only complaint about RR is that they can get busy om weekend nights and service can be sluggish, even when they are not busy.

The food at this location is generally always what is to be expected at the rest of the Red Robin locations. I enjoy the menu and the food is better than most of the other similar sit-down chains. The service is consistently good and the servers are upbeat, but not overbearing. The menu has gone through some subtle change lately, but it doesn't come across as desperation. I enjoy the bottomless fries, the shake options, and plenty of decent appetizers. For a good casual meal with quick service and enjoyable food this restaurant is often on our short list.

I'm a bit upset with RR this week.  My wife and I went on Wednesday wanting a burger.  The place was maybe 1/2 full but the hostess wrote our names down & said it would be a minute.  Odd...  After ten minutes another couple walked in & she told them that they were short-staffed & it might be almost an hour wait, even with a half empty restaurant.  That would have been good to know earlier.  We gave them a mulligan on a bad night & went back on Thursday.  We were immediately seated and had our meals in 15 minutes.  Problem is - they got it wrong.  Both of them... Our waitress apologized & quickly remedied the problem.  No harm done... until we got the check.  That's when I realized that they had forgotten to bring out appetizers that we had ordered.  They didn't forget to charge us, though.  I pointed this out to our waitress, who was mortified that she was going to have to tell her manager that our order had been messed up a third time.  We fixed the problem by getting it to go & she brought it out in a hurry.   In the end, everything came out fast and good.  I'd be more upset except that even with having to have our meals redone, they still came out fast.  I'll pretend that I caught them on two bad nights in a row.  I'll still go back.

Even Red Robin is all over the place, this is actually the first one ever been to.  I am not big meat person, so I cannot say I am a fan of gourmet burgers.  The ambience of this place feels like a 70-80s diner, and there is an interesting under the floor TV in the waiting room.  The place is generally clean enough and very crowded during lunch hours. Any burgers you order comes with bottomless fries, and the fries are very delicious.  If not for health reason, most could probably sit down and eat a few baskets of the fries.  They go very well with their special seasonings too.  Items mentioning are the Burnin' Love Burger, Chili Chili Cheeseburger, and the All-American Patty Melt.  The Burnin' Love Burger with described to be a somewhat spicy burger with jalapeño, but it tasted pretty sweet and dried, so do not expect any "burning" sensation from it.  The Chili Chili Burger had excessively amount of onions in it, which completely overpowered the chilli and cheese flavour.  The Patty Melt was ok, but slightly over greasy.  I also had the mint shake one time.  It tasted very good and fresh. Overall, I am not convince by their gourmet burgers, maybe there are better places out there that will convince me otherwise.  I would consider this place ok.
We have always loved Red Robin.  Great food, quick service, good atmosphere.  We come at least 2-3 times a month.

Despite being only about half full, we had to wait 10 minutes for a table. Once we were finally seated we waited a further 10 minutes for someone to take our order. That never occured. There were literally more workers than customers but none of the servers could be bothered to stop at our table. We left without a word and now I'm sitting at chili's where the service has been excellent so far. This location used to be great, I'm not sure what happened, but I won't be going back anytime soon.

When we arrived almost all of the tables were dirty, the toilet in the women's restroom was overflowing, we waited for 20 minutes just to give them our drink order, they forgot our chips and salsa, and then missed the bacon on my burger, we will not be back

This is a family friendly burger chain. This location had prompt, friendly service and atmosphere was decent. We had dinner on a Wednesday night, and wait was about 20mins. Parking lot was full, so just FYI in case you are looking for a quick bite or meeting up with friends.

Really!!! A loud as hell ballon blower by the hostess station!  Yes, as you wait for your table every minute or less!  Yes, the relaxing sound of what sounds like a leaf blower indoors. 105-115 decibels the same as a chainsaw or rock concert. Who's bright idea was this?  Oh, wait our service sucked! Orders wrong & part forgotten about! Yeah! Blame the kitchen for you putting our order in wrong.KristenF, love watching the other servers complain at the drink station with their attitudes & necks going this and that way about our table. Nice touch. We usually tip 25%!  Please retrain this server or firer her. She offered zero management to fix any of the situations. She offered zero help to fix any of the mistakes!  We will never go to this Red Robin again!!!  Not even one I'm sorry!!!

I placed a to-go order tonight. I called 3 times in a row and no one answered the phone. I decided to call on my wife's phone and was placed on hold for over 10 minutes. I tried on my phone again and finally got through to order. When I picked up my order the staff was polite and helpful. I decided to go away from my go-to meal (like an idiot) and ordered the Crab Cake sandwich. It tasted slightly better than a McDonald's filet-o-fish. The best part of the meal was the fry sauce. I usually like this place, so i'll give it another shot.

Our family has always love eating at this place. Very kid friendly. Menu seems to change each time raising prices. Our kids have loved the macaroni and cheese. The kids all noticed tonight the bowls the macaroni came in are much smaller than before. Then when we asked for refills tonight they said, "that since the new menus came out they don't do refills anymore". I don't think we will be bringing our family back here again.
Great burger, great onion rings. And our waiter was excellent. Richard is his name. Very pleasant experience.

Most people who think of Red Robin already know about the Bottomless Steak Fries. That company policy alone deserves 4 stars, and the staff has always been great about asking if we want more fries. They are more known for their burgers, but they make the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. My wife doesn't even ask me where I want to go for my birthday, it's just assumed. We're going to Red Robin for dinner!

Came for dinner the other day and was disappointed in the restaurants cleanliness over all. Sat in the bar area and watched as the waiters/waitresses contaminated just about everything they touched with their bare hands. The bar tender would make the drinks and use bare hands to put strawberries into the freckled lemonade, the waiters/waitresses would touch their face/hair then touch the lime/lemons to put in the drinks. One waiter was even scratching his hairy psoriasis arms and dug his hand into the container with the limes and placed it in the drink. Also another one would pour the chocolate shavings into her hand and eat a few then dump the rest on top on the milkshake. Another waitress was taking out a spoon that was in a milkshake and licked it.  WHO DOES THAT? Completely unprofessional. They also place drink trays leaning against the front of the area where the bar tender is, and they fell multiple times onto the dirty ground and would just pick them up and put them right back. Completely disgusted! I couldn't even finish my burger. They serve drinks on those contaminated trays to customers, the customers pick up whatever bacteria was on the floor by handling the cup their drink is in and then touch their burger. They might as well have dropped the burger on the floor and served it anyways. Makes me wonder what's going on in the kitchen. 1 star for our waitress who was timely and got the job done.

Red Robin the company seems to get gluten free, but clearly the Red Robin in LAYTON is not onboard.  They got me with the fry sauce. I was assured it was gluten free, but one taste and I knew... It is mixed with BBQ sauce.  Important note to all restaurant staff... Just because the bottle doesn't say "hey, there is gluten in this" doesn't mean it won't make me unbelievably sick for a week. Things like "artificial smoke flavoring" and "caramel coloring" are often sources of hidden gluten. Celiacs-avoid this place.

I came here with 3 other people on a Monday night, and it took 15 minutes for a server to come and greet us. We all just wanted water, and it took her about another 8 minutes to grab it. We quickly ordered after that cause we didn't know when she would be back, and we were in a rush. The food came out about 15-20 minutes after, which is fine. The food tasted great! I just wish our server would've been a little attentive to make our experience better.

Came in for lunch on Labor Day (which also coincided with Ogden temple open house).  It was insanity.  Oh the crowds of large parties!  Our wait was only about 10 minutes and our server Liz was prompt with the drinks- even proactive and didn't wait til our glasses were empty.  Our lunches arrived and were cold. Seriously, unappetizing cold. We had to flag down a different server who took them away and brought us hot fries.  When Liz brought out replacements, they were hot.  The prime rib dip was good, the clucks and fries were gross- all breading and no chicken.  Manager Steve comped our whole meal.  I believe they did the best they could considering the influx of people and they tried to make it right at every turn.

This place is pretty good; I agree with others though, it seems a little overpriced. I'm sure it's paying for the bottomless fries but no one in my family can eat that much. It was $24 just for my brother and I, not including tip. But I have always had friendly service here and no complaints, kids are usually well mannered (thanks to their parents) and aren't running around screaming like at some other places. All and all this place is one of my favorites and will continue to come here and recommend.
Good food, decent service, but sucks they don't honor the loyalty card from Red Robin Corporate. Just another example of Utah gone rogue.
